paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** HDFS CLI to Hive
**Objective:** Use HDFS CLI to import data to create Hive ORC tables
**File locations:** hostname:/tmp/cloudair hdfs:///data/cloudair
**Successful outcome:** Practice with using HDFS CLI and Hive ORC tables
**Before you begin:** Ensure data is available in the local file system
**Related lessons:** HDFS CLI and Recommended Practice for Data Life Cycle

---

msg.data:
About

Lab: HDFS CLI to Hive
Objective: Use HDFS CLI to import data to create Hive ORC tables
File locations: hostname:/tmp/cloudair hdfs:///data/cloudair
Successful outcome: Practice with using HDFS CLI and Hive ORC tables
Before you begin: Ensure data is available in the local file system
Related lessons: HDFS CLI and Recommended Practice for Data Life Cycle

paragraphs.title: Drop database
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS cloudair CASCADE;

paragraphs.title: Use bunzip2 to extract the files

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Load the raw data into HDFS

paragraphs.title: 1 - Make the directories in HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/cloudair
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir /data/cloudair
# Allow other users read/write access to the directory
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -chmod -R 777 /data/cloudair

hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /data/cloudair/eu_country
hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /data/cloudair/sale
hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /data/cloudair/us_customer
hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /data/cloudair/ww_customer

paragraphs.title: 2 - Copy the datafiles into HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -put /tmp/cloudair/eu_country.csv /data/cloudair/eu_country/
hdfs dfs -put /tmp/cloudair/sale.csv /data/cloudair/sale/
hdfs dfs -put /tmp/cloudair/us_customer.csv /data/cloudair/us_customer/
hdfs dfs -put /tmp/cloudair/ww_customer.csv /data/cloudair/ww_customer/

%md
#### Create stage and production tables for eu_country

msg.data: Create stage and production tables for eu_country

paragraphs.title: 6 - Create table eu_country_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS cloudair.eu_country_stage;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE cloudair.eu_country_stage(
  country_name STRING,
  country_code STRING,
  region STRING
  )
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ','
STORED AS TEXTFILE
LOCATION '/data/cloudair/eu_country';

paragraphs.title: 7 - Create managed table eu_country as ORC format
8 - Use an ITAS statement to load data into eu_country
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
INSERT INTO cloudair.eu_country SELECT * FROM cloudair.eu_country_stage;

[{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Create stage and production table for sale

msg.data: Create stage and production table for sale

paragraphs.title: 10 - Create table sale_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS cloudair.sale_stage;

CREATE TEMPORARY EXTERNAL TABLE cloudair.sale_stage(
    `entry_date` DATE,
    `item` STRING,
    `sales_code` INT,
    `cc_type` STRING,
    `first_name` STRING,
    `last_name` STRING,
    `city` STRING,
    `country_name` STRING,
    `purchase_date` DATE,
    `delivery_date` DATE,
    `purchase` DECIMAL(10,2),
    `credits` DECIMAL(10,2)
    )
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ','
STORED AS TEXTFILE
LOCATION '/data/cloudair/sale';

paragraphs.title: 11 - Create managed table sale as ORC format
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS cloudair.sale;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE cloudair.sale(
    `entry_date` DATE,
    `item` STRING,
    `sales_code` INT,
    `cc_type` STRING,
    `first_name` STRING,
    `last_name` STRING,
    `city` STRING,
    `country_name` STRING,
    `purchase_date` DATE,
    `delivery_date` DATE,
    `purchase` DECIMAL(10,2),
    `credits` DECIMAL(10,2)
    )
COMMENT 'Sale'
STORED AS ORC;

paragraphs.title: 12 - Use an ITAS statement to load data into sale
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
INSERT INTO cloudair.sale SELECT * FROM cloudair.sale_stage;

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Create stage and production table for us_customer

msg.data: Create stage and production table for us_customer

paragraphs.title: 14 - Create table us_customer_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS cloudair.us_customer_stage;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE cloudair.us_customer_stage(
    row_id STRING,
    title STRING,
    first_name STRING,
    middle_initial STRING,
    last_name STRING,
    name_set STRING,
    street_address STRING,
    city STRING,
    state STRING,
    state_name STRING,
    zip_code INT,
    country_id STRING,
    country_name STRING,
    telephone_country_code STRING,
    telephone_number STRING,
    email_address STRING,
    username STRING,
    password STRING,
    national_id STRING,
    mrn INT,
    insurance_id INT,
    cc_type STRING,
    cc_number STRING,
    cvv2 INT,
    cc_expires DATE,
    occupation STRING,
    company STRING,
    domain STRING,
    vehicle STRING,
    gender STRING,
    mothers_maiden STRING,
    birthday DATE,
    tropical_zodiac STRING,
    age INT,
    eye_color STRING,
    blood_type STRING,
    weight DOUBLE,
    height INT,
    latitude DOUBLE,
    longitude DOUBLE
    )
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED FIELDS 
TERMINATED BY ',' ESCAPED BY '"'
STORED AS TEXTFILE
LOCATION '/data/cloudair/us_customer'
tblproperties("skip.header.line.count"="1");

paragraphs.title: 15 - Create managed table us_customer as ORC format
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS cloudair.us_customer;

CREATE TABLE cloudair.us_customer(
    row_id STRING,
    title STRING,
    first_name STRING,
    middle_initial STRING,
    last_name STRING,
    name_set STRING,
    street_address STRING,
    city STRING,
    state STRING,
    state_name STRING,
    zip_code INT,
    country_id STRING,
    country_name STRING,
    telephone_country_code STRING,
    telephone_number STRING,
    email_address STRING,
    username STRING,
    password STRING,
    national_id STRING,
    mrn INT,
    insurance_id INT,
    cc_type STRING,
    cc_number STRING,
    cvv2 INT,
    cc_expires DATE,
    occupation STRING,
    company STRING,
    domain STRING,
    vehicle STRING,
    gender STRING,
    mothers_maiden STRING,
    birthday DATE,
    tropical_zodiac STRING,
    age INT,
    eye_color STRING,
    blood_type STRING,
    weight DOUBLE,
    height INT,
    latitude DOUBLE,
    longitude DOUBLE
    )
STORED AS ORC;

paragraphs.title: 16 - Use an ITAS statement to load data into us_customer
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
INSERT INTO cloudair.us_customer SELECT * FROM cloudair.us_customer_stage;

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Drop the stage tables and delete the raw data
~~~console
IAW Service Level Agreements (SLA) drop the staging tables and delete the raw data.
Data Lifecycle decisions need to be made about retention periods for raw and staging data. 
It is common practice not to DROP the staging tables, but to reload them.
A standard retention period for raw data is 24 hours, similar to batch processing.
~~~

msg.data:
Drop the stage tables and delete the raw data

IAW Service Level Agreements (SLA) drop the staging tables and delete the raw data.
Data Lifecycle decisions need to be made about retention periods for raw and staging data. 
It is common practice not to DROP the staging tables, but to reload them.
A standard retention period for raw data is 24 hours, similar to batch processing.
